meanings.definition: To hinder or prevent the progress or accomplishment of something.
meanings.sent1: The heavy rain stymies our plans for a picnic.
meanings.sent2: The locked gate stymies our entry into the garden.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel stymies our efforts to keep the bird feeder full.
meanings.sent4: The thick fog stymies our view of the beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent5: The tangled wires stymie our attempts to set up the new computer.

meanings.definition: A situation or obstacle that hinders progress or prevents success.
meanings.sent1: The lack of funding is a stymie in our project's development.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected traffic jam was a stymie to our timely arrival.
meanings.sent3: The broken elevator became a stymie for the residents on the top floor.
meanings.sent4: The language barrier proved to be a stymie in their communication.
meanings.sent5: The lost key was a stymie in their search for the hidden treasure.
